description: Your ability to understand users, validate ideas, and turn insights into product decisions.

scoreMeaning.strong: You systematically validate designs with users and use research insights to shape product decisions. Research is a regular habit, not a rare event.
scoreMeaning.decent: You do some research or usability checks, but it's not yet a consistent part of your process. You may struggle with method selection or synthesis.
scoreMeaning.needsImprovement: You mostly design from assumptions and internal opinions, with limited user validation. Research feels like a big, intimidating project.

strong: Create simple research templates (test scripts, discussion guides) for your team.
Involve PMs and devs in at least one research session per month.
Turn research findings into reusable frameworks (personas, journeys).
Run small, fast tests for incremental changes instead of waiting for big projects.
decent: Run 1 quick usability test for each major flow before release.
Write a problem statement and hypothesis before starting design.
Document findings in a single shared space for future reference.
Ask PMs or support for 3-5 real user tickets or calls each month.
needsImprovement: Talk to at least 2 real users or proxies this month.
Start with simple think-aloud tests using your current screens.
Summarize feedback into a short list of 'what worked' vs 'what confused users'.
Shadow support or ops for one hour to hear real user problems.

examplesOfStrong: You propose research activities as part of planning, not as an afterthought.
You push back on risky assumptions with lightweight tests.
You synthesize research into actionable insights that drive design decisions.
examplesOfWeak: Features ship without any user touchpoints or validation.
Research is only done for big redesigns, not everyday work.
You design based on internal opinions without checking with users.
